lines.text: [Jewish Ari Ben Canaan is masquerading as a gentile British officer named Bowen]

[about Jews]
They look funny too. I can spot one a mile away.

[pointing at his eye]
Would you mind looking into my eye, sir? It feels like a cinder.
Yes, certainly.
[Caldwell looks into Ben Canaan's eye]
You know, a lot of them try to hide under gentile names, but one look at their face, you just know.
With a little experience, you can even smell them out.
I'm sorry Bowen, I can't find a thing.
[first lines]

The island of Cyprus, madame. World famous for beauty, and long, tragic history. Been conquered many times, conquered by Phoenicians, Assyrians, Persians, Macedonians; also conquered by Greeks, Romans, Byzantines, Turks. Purchased from Turkey by your esteemed self, the British Empire. All Cyprus most wanted the British.

[correcting him]
I'm an American.
Fond of Americans, also; we Cypriots are fond of everybody.
[last lines]
Shalom.
God, don't let my brother die at the end of a British rope.

[explaining to the leaders of the Irgun how he survived Auschwitz]
The Germans used me -- like you would use a woman.

Dov, you're always fighting and you're always in a place where you might get killed. If anything happened to you before I could tell you how much I love you I just wouldn't want to live anymore. Please love me Dov. I'm not afraid, honest I'm not.
A year is a long time in the life of a pretty woman. Have you found another man?
Nothing serious.
Why not?

Many reasons. One is that my husband's work took up his whole life and I presume that's good or at least most men seem to think so. But I think that a man whose work is his whole life is only half a man.
And you want a whole one?
Exactly. The other half of his life must be a woman, what else?

[to Ari, discussing Jewish history in Jezreel]
Can't you understand that you make me feel like a Presbyterian when you can't, just for a minute or two, forget that you're a Jew?
In this fatal optimism, you are Haganah. In methodology you are Irgun. But in your heart, you are Israel.
We're really up to our necks in Jews, sir.

They're Cypriots. They would like to see the Britons in Britain, the Jews in Palestine and the Cypriots in Cyprus. Not, mind you, that I am anti-British. If I must have a master the British are by far the best. The problem my dear friends is why have a master at all?
